12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	The Tcl module-verbose routine allows switchin ver-  **
14   |  **			bosity on and off during module file execution	     **
15   |  ** 									     **
16   |  **   Exports:		cmdModuleVerbose				     **
17   |  ** 									     **

61   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
62   |

64   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/

69   | 
70   | /*++++
71   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
72   |  ** 									     **
73   |  **   Function:		cmdModuleVerbose				     **
74   |  ** 									     **
75   |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'verbose'			     **
76   |  ** 									     **
77   |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/31					     **
78   |  ** 									     **
79   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
80   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
81   |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
82   |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
83   |  ** 									     **
84   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
85   |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
86   |  ** 									     **
87   |  **   Attached Globals:	sw_verbose	The verbose level selector	     **
88   |  **   			g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
89   |  **					this function is called in order to  **
90   |  **					control everything		     **
91   |  ** 									     **
92   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
93   |  ++++*/
94   | 
95   | int cmdModuleVerbose(
96   | 	ClientData client_data,
97   | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
98   | 	int objc,
99   | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
100  | ) {
101  |     /**
102  |      **  Whatis mode?
103  |      **/
104  | 	if (g_flags & (M_WHATIS | M_HELP))
105  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** ------- EXIT PROCEDURE -------> **/
106  |     /**
107  |      **  Parameter check
108  |      **/
109  | 	if (objc < 2) {
110  | 		if (OK !=
111  | 		    ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
112  | 				" on|off|fmt [args]", NULL))
113  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
114  | 	}
115  |     /**
116  |      **  Display mode?
117  |      **/
118  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
119  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(*objv++));
120  | 		while (--objc)
121  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(*objv++));
122  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
123  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** ------- EXIT PROCEDURE -------> **/
124  | 	}
125  |     /**
126  |      **  on or off
127  |      **/
128  | 	if (!strcmp(Tcl_GetString(objv[1]), "on"))
129  | 		sw_verbose = 1;
130  | 	else if (!strcmp(Tcl_GetString(objv[1]), "off"))
131  | 		sw_verbose = 0;
132  | 	else {
133  | 		int	argc = --objc;
134  | 		char	**argv;
135  | 
136  | 		Tcl_ObjvToArgv(&argc, &argv, argc,++objv);
137  | 		Module_Verbosity(argc, argv);
138  | 	}
139  | 
140  | 	return (TCL_OK);
141  | 
142  | } /** End of 'cmdModuleVerbose' **/
